column1: This area above the <CASE> flag is for notes

column2: undefined keywords may be any number of spaces

column1: Note that demand has no decisions.
Note that unmet demand is represented a source with a variable cost only
column2: so unmet demand has an output decision.
Name of node from which this technology would get or give its energy (or in the case of transmission

column4: node from transmission will get its energy

column2: Pointer to time series file that will ultimately get loaded under the keyword <series>
Possible non-negative number. If 'normalization' is defined
column3: then the series associated with that tech (defined by series_file) is transformed to have a mean equal to the number supplied

column2: Option to specify the capacity of a technology. If this number is supplied
column3: then the technology capacity is fixed and is not included as a decision variable in the optimization

column2: Fixed cost, must be defined if n_capacity > 0
Variable cost, must be defined if n_dispatch_in > 0 or n_dispatchout > 0
Possible contraint for case when n_capacity = 1
Possible factor for case when n_capacity = 1, n_dispatch_in =1 and n_dispatch_out = 1 (e.g., battery), applied on way in to reservoir, also known as round trip efficiency
Possible decay rate for storage in units of fraction per time step
